description: 2-hour exam with 10 minutes reading time covering all course content, requiring proofs and calculations. Assesses problem-solving skills across algebra and analysis topics.
Two individual assignments on analysis content (due Weeks 8 and 10) involving proofs, calculations, and manipulation of fundamental inequalities. First worth 10%, second 15%.
Two short individual assignments on algebra content (due Weeks 2 and 4) involving proofs, calculations, and group theory applications. Each worth 5%.
In-class test in Week 5 assessing algebra content from Weeks 1-4, focusing on groups, transformations, and projective geometry.
